intro: Dayena inermis, commonly known as the smooth dayflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family, which includes plants such as spiderworts and water hyacinths. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous. Its flowers are small, clustered in racemes, and typically have three petals and three sepals. Dayena inermis is often found in moist, sandy soils near streams and in open woodlands.
